neighborhood_overview: Within a one block radius are three subway lines, a new supermarket, an array of restaurants and shops as well as several nationally significant historic landmarks. Among the nearby attractions are: Old South Meetinghouse (from where the Boston Tea Party started), The Corner Bookstore (which once housed the publishing house of Ralph Waldo Emerson and Louisa May Alcott), the Boston Common (America’s oldest public park), the Massachusetts Statehouse (designed by Boston’s Charles Bulfinch who also designed the Capitol Building in Washington DC), The Old Statehouse (the seat of power for the colonial British government), the towers of Boston’s financial district, the shops of Downtown Crossing (including H&M, Macy’s, Penmark, Marshall’s, TJ Maxx, Eddie Bauer), the Opera House, the Modern Theater, and the Paramount Theater, as well as Loew’s Boston Common cinemas, and Chinatown.

The Downtown Crossing station of the Red and Orange lines are across the street. The State Street station of the Blue Line (which connects to the airport) is a five minute walk and the Green line's Park Street Station is a five minute walk.

neighborhood_overview: Downtown Crossing is the center of Boston and it's history. From the apt window you see Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Downtown, and the Financial District. The area can seem busy during both day and night, however it is very safe. There is police on almost every corner, security in many buildings, and as long as I lived here, nothing poor has happened. Within minutes walking there are some of the best restaurants, theaters, bars, clubs, therefore the area is always busy. But an amazing part about Boston and its people is that most are polite and mindful.
notes: Location, location, location! It's an amazing area, however keep in mind that while enjoying the city of Boston you are coming to a tight cozy place, so having a lot of large suitcases will be challenging (although there is an elevator).  One large suitcase or a few small ones with some bags should be perfectly fine.  This place is not recommended for children or babies, these little humans usually need space to roam, and I'd hate to limit them :) PS, if you are coming anytime after October until April, don't forget warm clothes, gloves, hats, and scarves! Boston can get quite windy.
transit: Your best bet for parking is a parking garage, but I recommend getting around by public transport as it can bring you to many places you want to go. If you were to get a garage, check out SpotHero app - they have discounted garage parking spots available. Just across the street from the building entrance there are Green and Red Lines, and less than a block away there is an Orange and Blue Lines.

summary: This place offers a perfect location with the value and camaraderie of a hostel, as well as the security, privacy, class, and cleanliness of an expensive hotel.  At this place, there are plenty of like-minded people to meet and set out with as you explore all the history and nightlife Boston has to offer. Remember to read the 'guest handbook' when you book to answer all your questions.
space: A word of caution, this is Downtown Boston so just like any prime location, it comes with noise at night!  With that said, being on the 4th vaulted floor, 100 feet above the streets, is higher up than most rentals in this area.  Anyway... My home is your home!  There are three traditionally styled guest bedrooms.  King's cabin is spacious, with loads of natural light, excellent layout, exposed brick, vaulted ceilings, and a queen bed.  An innerspring mattress is available if you want but the air mattresses are comfier. This is an old office building converted into a rustic style loft apartment. host_about:
Hi there, 
I'm originally from Atlanta but have been living Boston in the famous the North End of Boston for the last 15 years.  Last summer I had the pleasure of AirBnB'ing in St. Petersburg Florida and I'm looking forward to continuing that here in Boston.  I owned and operated a hostel in downtown Boston for six years and I'm a big fan of hostels, so the spaces I rent are often shared.
.  
I love traveling, meeting travelers and helping them out with finding affordable accommodation where ever I am.  I'm opening another hostel soon and thought this would be a great way to continue what I like to do in the meantime.  Safe Travels!!
